p: In folklore medicine, the Suaeda group of plants are used as fodder ( Ishnava et al., 2011) against rheumatism, paralysis, asthma, snake-bites, skin disease and ulcer ( Kathiresan and Ramanathan, 1997; Muthazhagan et al., 2014). Again, leaves of such plants are used as antiviral, antibacterial and wound healing activities ( Manivachagam et al., 2008; Ravikumar et al., 2010, 2011), besides as insecticide ( Fahmy et al., 2003) and antiplasmodial against Plasmodium falciparum ( Sundaram et al., 2011).
